verses.verse: And David<WH1732> consulted<WH3289> with the captains<WH8269> of thousands<WH505> and hundreds<WH3967>, and with every leader<WH5057>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto all the congregation<WH6951> of Israel<WH3478>, If it seem good<WH2895> unto you<WH3068>, and that it be of the Lord our God<WH430>, let us send<WH7971> abroad<WH6555> unto our brothers<WH251> every where<WH7604>, that are left in all the land<WH776> of Israel<WH3478>, and with them also to the priests<WH3548> and Levites<WH3881> which are in their cities<WH5892> and suburbs<WH4054>, that they may gather themselves unto us<WH6908>:
And let us bring again<WH5437> the ark<WH727> of our God<WH430> to us<WH1875>: for we inquired not at it in the days<WH3117> of Saul<WH7586>.
And all the congregation<WH6951> said<WH559> that they would do so<WH6213>: for the thing<WH1697> was right<WH3474> in the eyes<WH5869> of all the people<WH5971>.

So David<WH1732> gathered<WH6950> all Israel<WH3478> together<WH6950>, from Shihor<WH7883> of Egypt<WH4714> even unto the entering<WH935> of Hemath<WH2574>, to bring<WH935> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> from Kirjath<WH7157>–jearim.

And David<WH1732> went up<WH5927>, and all Israel<WH3478>, to Baalah<WH1173>, that is<WH7157>, to Kirjath–jearim, which belonged to Judah<WH3063>, to bring up<WH5927> there the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> the Lord<WH3068>, that dwells<WH3427> between the cherubims<WH3742>, whose name<WH8034> is called on it<WH7121>.
And they carried<WH7392> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> in a new<WH2319> cart<WH5699> out of the house<WH1004> of Abinadab<WH41>: and Uzza<WH5798> and Ahio<WH283> drove<WH5090> the cart<WH5699>.

And David<WH1732> and all Israel<WH3478> played<WH7832> before<WH6440> God<WH430> with all their might<WH5797>, and with singing<WH7892>, and with harps<WH3658>, and with psalteries<WH5035>, and with tambourines<WH8596>, and with cymbals<WH4700>, and with trumpets<WH2689>.
And when they came<WH935> unto the threshingfloor<WH1637> of Chidon<WH3592>, Uzza<WH5798> put forth<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> to hold<WH270> the ark<WH727>; for the oxen<WH1241> stumbled<WH8058>.

And the anger<WH639> of the Lord<WH3068> was kindled<WH2734> against Uzza<WH5798>, and he struck<WH5221> him<WH7971>, because he put his hand<WH3027> to the ark<WH727>: and there he died<WH4191> before<WH6440> God<WH430>.

And David<WH1732> was displeased<WH2734>, because the Lord<WH3068> had made<WH6555> a breach<WH6556> upon Uzza<WH5798>: why that place<WH4725> is called<WH7121> Perez<WH6560>–uzza to this day<WH3117>.
And David<WH1732> was afraid<WH3372> of God<WH430> that day<WH3117>, saying<WH559>, How<WH1963> shall I bring<WH935> the ark<WH727> of God home to me<WH430>?
So David<WH1732> brought<WH5493> not the ark<WH727> home to himself to the city<WH5892> of David<WH1732>, but carried it aside<WH5186> into the house<WH1004> of Obed<WH5654>–edom the Gittite<WH1663>.

And the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> remained<WH3427> with the family<WH1004> of Obed<WH5654>–edom in his house<WH1004> three<WH7969> months<WH2320>. And the Lord<WH3068> blessed<WH1288> the house<WH1004> of Obed<WH5654>–edom, and all that he had.
